agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization providing an addiction recovery program in transitional housing for men.
service_description: Provides alcohol and drug use recovery program in a transitional housing facility for men. Program is faith-based and lasts one year.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to download application. Once complete, mail application to site address.

site_schedule.name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services

site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Wanting to end drug or alcohol addiction -- Able to self-pay for program

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Marshall County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Marshall County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 8:30am and 3rd Mon at 9:45am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 8:30am and 3rd Mon at 9:45am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MARSHALL COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Marshall County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MARSHALL COUNTY
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the general public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours. Pick-up is available within set boundaries by appointment.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

Living in Marshall County -- Household income between 25%-60% of median (Call or see website for current amounts) -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_name: BREAD OF LIFE COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization serving as a community-based food pantry to those in need.
site_name: BREAD OF LIFE COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need. Assistance with transportation to and from the pantry may be provided.
site_details: Walk in for service. -- For Transportation: Call Marshall County Council on Aging to arrange transportation.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County -- Low income -- Limit one visit every two weeks
Age 60 or older -- Income that is at or less than 130% of the federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open
Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Community Hospital of Bremen (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a thrift store.
site_name: CHRISTS HANDS AND FEET IN ACTION SWAP SHOP
service_description: Accepts donations to "swap" for donated clothing (baby through adult sizes) available in the store. Toys, furniture, appliances, and other household items may be available, depending on donations. Swapping items is preferred, but not required.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule a screening appointment. If voicemail is reached, leave name and number for a return call.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran.

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF MARSHALL COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF MARSHALL COUNTY - PLYMOUTH
service_description: Provides a supervised environment with enrichment programs for young people after school and during the summer.
site_details: Call for information. -- Walk in or download application from website.

site_schedule.name: Boys/Girls Clubs
site_schedule.schedule: School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 3pm-7pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 7:45am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Youth Enrichment Programs
site_schedule.schedule: School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 3pm-7pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 7:45am-5pm

site_eligibility: Boys and girls ages 5-18; 5 year-old children must be in Kindergarten

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF MARSHALL COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF MARSHALL COUNTY - BREMEN
service_description: Provides a supervised environment with enrichment programs for young people after school and during the summer.
site_details: Call for information. -- Walk in or download application from website.

site_schedule.name: Boys/Girls Clubs
site_schedule.schedule: School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 3pm-6pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 7:45am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Youth Enrichment Programs
site_schedule.schedule: School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 3pm-6pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 7:45am-5pm

site_eligibility: Boys and girls ages 5-18; 5 year-old children must be in Kindergarten

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A council consisting of local churches that provide charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Milk and eggs may be available depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in and proceed downstairs.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, including frozen meats and personal hygiene items to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this pantry in the past 14 days; Living in the Argos area.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a local food pantry and the Commodity Supplemental Food Pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meats to those in need. Pantry also has cleaning supplies on second Wednesdays and hygiene products on fourth Wednesdays. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Provides support to partner agencies and programs to address human service needs. Seeks funding through corporate giving programs and individual donations. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Call or visit website for information or to make a contribution.
site_eligibility: Nonprofit human service agencies

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Offers free, objective information on Medicare, Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans, Medicaid, long-term care insurance, and prescription assistance programs. SHIP counselors are trained and certified by the Indiana Department of Insurance.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare
Age 60 or older -- Classes: Open
Home-bound due to age or a disability
Open
Looking for transportation to destinations in Indiana

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Marshall County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Marshall County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Marshall County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; Live Assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Varies by service; serves Marshall County

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

Living within the Marshall County or a surrounding county-- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
With a private well
Age 19 or older
Varies by service; serves Marshall County
Varies by service; call for information
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Age 6 months or older
Living within the county

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a household development service, including assistance with food, clothing, utilities, and holiday gifts.
service_description: Provides comprehensive case management to people in Marshall County needing support and assistance with challenges to self sufficiency. Services may include life skills instruction, money management principles, pre-job guidance, and referrals to partnering community agencies, This program typically lasts 6-12 months.
site_details: Walk in to apply, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Income at or below 125% of Federal Poverty Level
Living in Marshall County -- limit one visit per month

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Marshall County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Marshall County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Marshall County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Marshall County.
service_description: Maintains the Marshall County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older
Open; serves Marshall County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides early childhood education.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Age 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st)
Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age three (3) years -- Other special circumstances may be considered for limited additional slots

agency_desc: Provides animal control and animal shelter services for the county.
service_description: Offers low-cost spay/neuter services, ear-tipping, vaccinations, and medical care for unowned, free-roaming cats. Provides training and education on trap-neuter-return (TNR) and feral colony management. Trapping and transporting assistance is sometimes available.
site_details: Call to request assistance, once approved, you must sign a contract and schedule an appointment. -- Bring community cats in a humane live trap.

site_schedule.name: Neuter/Spay Services
site_schedule.schedule: Monthly 3rd Tues -- Check in/Drop off: 7am; Return: 6:30pm -- By appointment only

site_eligibility: Free-roaming un-owned cats
Open; serves Marshall County
Must be a Marshall County resident -- Not received assistance within the past month
Pet owners

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers after school and summer programs for children and teens age 5-12.
service_description: Offers after school and summer programs for children and teens age 5-12.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Boys and girls ages 5-12

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Argos in Marshall County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Argos in Marshall County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Dial 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Argos in Marshall County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Bartholomew, Dearborn, Decatur, Franklin, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, and St Joseph County.

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
service_description: Offers Farmers Market vouchers to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $20 in vouchers, while supplies last.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, or to apply.
site_eligibility:
Living in Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, Fulton, or St Joseph County
Age 60 or older
Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines
Age 60 or older (and accompanying spouse of any age)

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger
With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula
First trimester of pregnancy

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
